verses.verse: As streams of waters, the king's heart is in the hand of Jehovah; He extends it wherever He desires.
Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but Jehovah weighs the hearts.
For Jehovah, to do righteousness and justice is to be chosen more than sacrifice.
High eyes, a proud heart, and the fallow ground of the wicked ones, is sin.
The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenty, but those of every one being hasty only to poverty.
The acquisition of treasures by a tongue of falsehood is a vapor driven by those who seek death.
The violence of wickedness drags them down, because they refuse to do justice.
The work of a guilty man is perverted; but the pure one is an upright one.
It is better to dwell on a corner of a housetop, than with a woman of contentious, and to share a house.
The soul of wicked ones desires an evil thing; his neighbor finds no favor in his eyes.
The one of simplicity is made to be wise when the scorner is punished, and when the wise one is instructed, he takes in knowledge.
The Righteous One is acting wisely toward the house of the wicked one; He subverts wickedness for its evil.
One shutting his ears at the cry of the poor one, he himself shall also call and shall not be answered.
A gift in secret subdues anger; yea, a bribe in the bosom quiets fierce fury.
It is joy to the righteous one to do justice, but ruin shall come to the workers of iniquity.
The man who wanders out of the way of prudence shall rest in the assembly of departed spirits.
A man who loves pleasure shall have poverty, he who loves wine and oil shall not be rich.
The wicked one shall be a ransom for the righteous one, and the one acting treacherously instead of the upright ones.
It is better to live in a land of the wilderness than with a woman of contentions and anger.
A treasure to be desired and oil are in the dwelling of the wise ones, but a man who is a fool swallows it.
He pursuing righteousness and mercy finds life, righteousness and honor.
A wise one makes the city of the mighty ones go up, and makes go down the force in which it trusts.
Whoever guards his mouth and his tongue guards his soul from distresses.
The proud arrogant one, scoffer is his name, he who deals in proud wrath.
The lust of the lazy man kills him, for his hands have refused to work.
All the day he longs with lust, but the righteous one gives and does not withhold.
The sacrifice of the wicked ones is a disgusting thing; how much more when he brings it with an evil intent!
A witness of falsehood shall perish, but the man who hears will speak forever.
A wicked man hardens his face, but he, the upright one, establishes his way.
There is no wisdom and no understanding and no counsel against Jehovah.
The horse is made ready for the day of battle, but to Jehovah belongs deliverance.
